sentences: Meie eelistatud filmi on veel p√§ev ootel.
context: The word 'filmi' is a grammatical form of the Estonian noun 'film'. It appears as the genitive singular, partitive singular, and illative singular forms. In English translation, it generally refers to 'film' in different grammatical cases - indicating possession ('of film'), partial reference ('some film'), or direction/intent ('into film'). The word can be used in various contexts when discussing movies, photography films, or the concept of film itself.
